children.subject:
Having taken cs88, I would say data 8 wouldn't be too bad. 

For 61a, I would say it depends on the schedule of your internship but cs88 would have taught you core concepts of 61a...

If you had to take a summer class, Data 8 would be the safer option for sure, since you'd only need a 2.0 in it to declare DS and wouldn't need it at all to declare CS. It's probably not a great idea to take 61A alongside an internship, since that class has a high workload; and Berkeleytime seems to show the last couple of summers have a roughly B average (and you'd want to shoot for B+ or higher to start you off on a good foot toward declaring CS). If you don't take 61A over the summer, that's fine, because you have an internship and in a way that's a lot of progress toward your career and you can afford to take it easy with classes. I would take Data if you have to take a summer class since it would probably be a lot less stressful.

history.content: Some internships don't allow you to take classes while interning. For example, Google explicitly states in the offer letter to not take any classes while interning. Plus, if you are interning at a fairly rigorous company, you will not have any time to breath if you take a course on top of it. If the internship is very lax then go for it!

Plus, if you are interning at a fairly rigorous company, you will not have any time to breath if you take a course on top of it. If the internship is very lax then go for it!

Some internships don't allow you to take classes while interning. For example, I know Google explicitly states to not take any classes while interning. Plus, if you are interning at a fairly rigorous company, you will not have any time to breath if you take a course on top of it.

I am currently taking cs88 and will be doing an internship over the summer. Does anyone know if it would be doable to take cs61a or Data 8 over the summer as well? I am trying to have my options open for declaring either Data Science or CS. What would you recommend?
history.subject: Internship and summer class
